entry.title: 24 Verify Post-order Squence Of BST
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

输入一个整数数组，判断该数组是不是某二叉搜索树的后序遍历的结果。如果是则输出Yes,否则输出No。假设输入的数组的任意两个数字都互不相同。


Problem Statement:

Given an integer array, judge whether it is a kind of post-order traversal of a binary search tree. Each element in the array is unique.


Solution:

Suppose arr = {4,8,6,12,16,14,10}, then 10 is the root, {12,16,14} are in the right subtree since they are greater than 10 and {4,8,6} are in the left subtree since they are smaller than 10. Then we check {12,16,14}, 14 is the root, 12 is in the left subtree and 16 is in the right subtree… so this is a recursion, repeat this process, we have a possible BST (we do not have in-order sequence so we cannot determine the BST):

Now we want to know in what cases that a post-order sequence is invalid.
entry.summary:

entry.title: 21 Min Stack
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

定义栈的数据结构，请在该类型中实现一个能够得到栈最小元素的min函数。


Problem Statement:

Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time.


Solution:

LC 155

The idea is to push old min twice, so we could find what is the min after poping current min element directly.

entry.title: 22 Is Stack Pop Order
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

输入两个整数序列，第一个序列表示栈的压入顺序，请判断第二个序列是否为该栈的弹出顺序。假设压入栈的所有数字均不相等。例如序列1,2,3,4,5是某栈的压入顺序，序列4, 5,3,2,1是该压栈序列对应的一个弹出序列，但4,3,5,1,2就不可能是该压栈序列的弹出序列。（注意：这两个序列的长度是相等的）


Problem Statement:

Given two integer sequence, the first one represents the push order of a stack, judge whether the second sequence can be a kind of pop order of this stack.


Solution:

We can push each element in push[] to a stack, and each time we push an element, check whether it is equal to the current element we are visiting in pop[], if yes, pop this element (peek()), notice after popping it, the next peek element in the stack may equal to the enxt element in pop[], so this should be checked in a while loop.

entry.title: 18 Substructure of a Tree
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

输入两棵二叉树A，B，判断B是不是A的子结构。（ps：我们约定空树不是任意一个树的子结构）


Problem Statement:

Given two trees, A and B, judge whether B is a sub-structure of A.


Solution:

Suppose A and B are following, then B is a sub-structure of A.

We first try to compare A’s root (6) with B’s root (8), our aim is to find a node is A that has the same value with B’s root. 6 != 8, so we keep trying to compare A’s left and right subtree with B’s root. try 2, 2 != 8, then try 8, 8 = 8, here we can search down from A’s 8 and B’s root (8), compare their nodes one by one.

entry.title: 20 Spiral Matrix
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

输入一个矩阵，按照从外向里以顺时针的顺序依次打印出每一个数字，例如，如果输入如下矩阵：

则依次打印出数字: 1,2,3,4,8,12,16,15,14,13,9,5,6,7,11,10.


Problem Statement:

Given a matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order.


Solution:

LC-54

Use 4 variables to control the position, just be careful that when go right from left and from bottom to top, we need to judge whether rowBegin <= rowEnd and colBegin <= colEnd to avoid print one more time.

For example, if our matrix is [1,2,3,4,5], just a single row, then after we traverse from left to right and pirnt {1,2,3,4,5}, we should not traverse from right to left and print {5,4,3,2,1} thus have {1,2,3,4,5,5,4,3,2,1}.
entry.summary:

entry.title: 15 Find the kth Last Element in LinkedList
entry.content:
Problem Statement:

输入一个链表，输出该链表中倒数第k个结点。


Problem Statement:

Given a linked list, find the kth last node in it.


Solution:

We can use two pointers - slow and fast. Let fast pointer move (k-1) steps fisrt, then let both pointer move simultaneously, then when fast reaches the tail of the list, slow is pointing the kth last node.

entry.title: 09 Fibonacci and Jump Floor
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

1 计算斐波那契数组

2 跳台阶，一次可以跳1级或2级，求跳上n级台阶有多少种跳法

3 跳台阶，一次可以跳1到n级，求跳上n级台阶有多少种跳法

4 我们可以用2*1的小矩形横着或者竖着去覆盖更大的矩形。请问用n个2*1的小矩形无重叠地覆盖一个2*n的大矩形，总共有多少种方法？


Problem Statement in English:

1 Calculate Fibonacci Number

2 Jump floor, you can jump 1 or 2 steps each time. How many ways to jump from floor 0 to floor n?

3 Jump floor, you can jump 1 to n steps each time. How many ways to jump from floor 0 to floor n?

4 We can use a 2*1 small matrix horizontally (1*2) or vertivally (2*1) to cover a bigger matrix. How many ways do we have to cover a 2*n matrix with n 2*1 matrices?


Solutions:

Question1:


Question2:


Question3:

Question3 can be solved by math. Use $f(n)$ to denote the total number of ways to jump to floor n.

Keep simplifying this formula, calculate $f(n-1)$.

So we have:

Since $f(1) = 1$, we can infer that $f(n) = 2^{n-1}$


Question4:

For a matrix with length n, consider how we cover its left-most area.

(1) If we put a small matrix vertivally (cover 1*2), then we need to fill the sub matrix of length n-1.

(2) If we put a small matrix horizontally (cover 2*1), then we need to fill the sub matrix of length n-2 and we can put another 2*1 small matrix below the one we’ve put.

So this is still essntially a Fibonacci problem.
entry.summary:

entry.title: 03 Search Two Dimensional Array
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

在一个二维数组中，每一行都按照从左到右递增的顺序排序，每一列都按照从上到下递增的顺序排序。请完成一个函数，输入这样的一个二维数组和一个整数，判断数组中是否含有该整数。


Problem Statement in English:

This problem is identical to LC-74:

Write an efficient algorithm that searches for a value in an m x n matrix. This matrix has the following properties:

  • Integers in each row are sorted from left to right.
  • The first integer of each row is greater than the last integer of the previous row.

For example,

Consider the following matrix:

Given target = 3, return true.


Solution:

We can start from top-right corner, from the problem statement we know that all the elements that are left to it are smaller than it and all the elements that are down to it are greater than it. So we simply compare this element with our target and move left or down.
entry.summary:

在一个二维数组中，每一行都按照从左到右递增的顺序排序，每一列都按照从上到下递增的顺序排序。请完成一个函数，输入这样的一个二维数组和一个整数，判断数组中是否含有该整数。

entry.title: 04 Replace Whitespace
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

请实现一个函数，将一个字符串中的空格替换成“%20”。例如，当字符串为We Are Happy. 则经过替换之后的字符串为We%20Are%20Happy。


Problem Statement in English:

Write a function to replace all whitespace in a string with “%20”. For example, “We Are Happy” is changed to “We%20Are%20Happy”.


Solution:

If we can use “replaceAll()” in Java, then just use it.


If we need to implement this function manually, we can do it in two steps.

  1. Scan the string to find how many whitespace it has. (In order to determine the size of the new stirng after replacement)
  2. Since now we have the new size and we are going to extending the stirng (‘ ‘ to “%20”), we can traverse the string and fill the new one from end to front for convenience.
entry.summary:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

请实现一个函数，将一个字符串中的空格替换成“%20”。例如，当字符串为We Are Happy. 则经过替换之后的字符串为We%20Are%20Happy。

entry.title: 07 Implement a Queue with two Stacks
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

用两个栈来实现一个队列，完成队列的Push和Pop操作。 队列中的元素为int类型。


Problem Statement in English:

Implement a Queue with two Stacks, elements are integers.


Solution:

Queues are FIFO, and Stacks are FILO.

For push(), just push the new element onto stack1.

For pop(), if stack2 is not empty, pop one element of stack2; if it is empty, pop all elements of stack1 and push them onto stack2, finally, pop one element of stack2.
entry.summary:

Problem State

entry.title: 06 Reconstruct a Binary Tree
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

输入某二叉树的前序遍历和中序遍历的结果，请重建出该二叉树。假设输入的前序遍历和中序遍历的结果中都不含重复的数字。例如输入前序遍历序列{1,2,4,7,3,5,6,8}和中序遍历序列{4,7,2,1,5,3,8,6}，则重建二叉树并返回。


Problem Statement in English:

Given the pre-order traversal and in-order traversal of a binary tree, build this tree. You may assume there will be no duplicate in either pre-order or in-order list.


Solution:

We can use pre-order list to determine the root and in-order list to determine this root’s left and right subtrees.

Suppose pre-order list is {5,4,2,7,6,8}, and in-order list is {2,4,5,6,7,8}. Now consider the 1st element in preorder list, we can know that 5 is the root, and {2,4} are in its left subtree while {6,7,8} are in its right subtree.

For 5’s left subtree, just consider the element next to 5 in the preorder list, which is 4. So 4 is the root of 5’s left subtree, check inorder list, we can infer {2} is in its left subtree and 4 has no right child.

For 5’s right subtree, we need to do somework - determine the size of the left subtree to get the correct index or the root of the right subtree. $|{2,4}| = 2$, so the root should be at index 0 + 2 + 1 = 3, which is 7, where 0 is the index of 5, 2 is the size of the left subtree.

Repeat this process, we will build the tree.

Following is the actual code:
entry.summary:

entry.title: 05_PrintListReversely
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

输入一个链表，从尾到头打印链表每个节点的值。


Problem Statement in English:

Print a linked list from its tail to its head.


Solution 1 (Recursion):

We can solve this problem recursively. We process the rest of the list first, after this is done, print the node, so the first node to be printed is the tail, the second is the one before tail…


Solution 2 (Stack):

Now that the problem can be solved recursively, it can also be solved using a stack. We just push all nodes onto a stack, then pop them out.


Solution 3:

If we can modify the list itself (usually we are now allowed to do so and we should not since this is just a print operation), then we just reverse this list and print.

entry.title: 08 Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

把一个数组最开始的若干个元素搬到数组的末尾，我们称之为数组的旋转。 输入一个非递减排序的数组的一个旋转，输出旋转数组的最小元素。 例如数组{3,4,5,1,2}为{1,2,3,4,5}的一个旋转，该数组的最小值为1。 NOTE：给出的所有元素都大于0，若数组大小为0，请返回0。


Problem Statement in English:

LC-153

Suppose an array sorted in ascending order is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.

(i.e., 0 1 2 4 5 6 7 might become 4 5 6 7 0 1 2).

Find the minimum element.

You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.


Solution:

Consider the element in the middle position, call it mid, then there are three cases.

(1) nums[mid] < nums[mid - 1]

For example, [6,7,8,1,2,3,4], nums[mid] = 1, 1 < 8. In this case, we find the minimum number, which is 1.

For a sorted array, nums[mid - 1] should be smaller than nums[mid], now the array is rotated, we can treat it as two subarray and each of is sorted, [part1, part2] ([6,7,8], [1,2,3,4]). Unless the original array is not rotated, all elements in part1 must be greater than all element is part2, and the right-most element in part1 is the biggest one in it, the left-most element in part2 is the smallest one in it and thus the minimum in the whole original array.

So if nums[mid-1] > nums[mid], then nums[mid-1] must be the right-most element in part1 and nums[mid] must be the left-most element in part2. Thus nums[mid] is the minimum number.

(2) nums[mid] > nums[mid - 1] && nums[lo] <= nums[mid] && nums[mid] > nums[hi]

For example, [4,5,6,7,8,1,2,3]. Size of part1 is larger than that of part2, since unless the original array is not rotated, all elements in part1 must be greater than all element is part2, the minimum number should be in part2, thus lo = mid + 1;

(3) (nums[mid] > nums[mid - 1] && nums[lo] > nums[mid] || nums[mid] <= nums[hi])

For example, [7,8,1,2,3,4,5,6] or [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8]

In this case, the minimum number should be in part2 (but $|part1| < |part2|$, we still update hi = mid-1) or the original array is not rotated, either way, hi = mid - 1

entry.title: 14 Reorganize an array
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

输入一个整数数组，实现一个函数来调整该数组中数字的顺序，使得所有的奇数位于数组的前半部分，所有的偶数位于位于数组的后半部分，并保证奇数和奇数，偶数和偶数之间的相对位置不变。


Problem Statement in English:

Given an int array, write a function to move all odd number to the first half of the array and all the even number to the second half of the array. Make sure that the numbers’ relative position not changed.

For example, input is {2,4,6,1,2,8,4,7} => {1,7,2,4,6,2,8,4}


Solution:

Since we need to keep original relative position, we can solve this problem by the idea of insertion sort. See code below:


If we do not have to keep original relative position, we can simply use two pointers to swap odd and even number.
entry.summary:

entry.title: 10 Number Of One
entry.content:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

输入一个整数，输出该数二进制表示中1的个数。其中负数用补码表示。


Problem Statement in English:

Given a number, output the number of 1s in its binary representation. Negative number should be represented as its complemental code.


Solution:

(n-1) & n actually means removing the last 1 in n each time. Concretely:

(1) If n is an odd number, its binary representation is xx...x1, n-1 is xx...x0, so the result of n&(n-1) is xx...x0, we removed the last 1 in n.

(2) If n is an even number, its binary representation is xx...x10...0, n-1 is xx...x01...0, so the result of n&(n-1) is xx...x00...0, we also removed the last 1 in n.
entry.summary:
Problem Statement in Chinese:

输入一个整数，输出该数二进制表示中1的个数。其中负数用补码表示。


Problem Statement in En

entry.title: Unbounded Knapsack Problem
entry.content:
1. Description

Given n kinds items,each with a weight and a value determine the subset of items such that the total weight <= a given capacity W, and the total value V is as large as possible. Here, we are allowed to use unlimited number of instances of an item.

For example,

2. A simple thought - $O(nW\sum{\frac{W}{w_k}})$

The difference between Unbounded Knapsack Problem and 0-1 Knapsack Problem is that here we can choose an item many times.

An naive thought towards this problem is that we try all possiblities that an item $k$ can be chosen (It can be chosen $[0, \lfloor\frac{w}{w_k}\rfloor]$ times, where w is current available capacity, initially W.

Use notation $dp[k,w]$ to represent the optimal value using a knapsack of capacity $0 \le w \le W$ and with first $k$ kinds of items, $1\le k\le n$.

(1) If we do not take item $k$, $dp[k,w] = dp[k-1, w]$
(2) If we do take item $k$, $dp[k,w] = max{dp[k-1, w-cwk] + cv_k}$, where $0 \le cw{k} \le w$, i.e. $0 \le c \le \lfloor\frac{W}{w_k}\rfloor$

So our recurrence relation is:

Time complexity for this will be $O(nW\sum{\frac{W}{w_k}})$. But we can do some pruning, if $v_i > v_j$ && $w_i < w_j$, then we do not have to consider item $j$.

3. Solution - O(nW)

In 0-1 knapsack problem, we came up with the solution:

We can slightly modify this solution to solve this Unbounded Knapsack Problem:

As you can see, the only difference between these two solution is just the order of the inner for-loop.

So, why could this solution work? Let’s first review why in 0-1 Knapsack Problem we decrement w. The purpose of decrementing w is to make sure that in the kth round, status dp[k,w] comes from dp[k-1, w-w[k]]. In other words, this is to make sure that each item can only be chosen once.

But now, our Unbounded Knapsack Problem does not have this requirement, so when considering “adding the kth kind of item”, we also need to consider the sub-result that we have already chosen the kth kind of item, which isdp[k, w-w[k]]. That’s why we can increment w here.

We can also switch the two for-loops in the solution, like this:

If we write down the Unbounded Knapsack Problem‘s transition equation explicitly, we’ll have:

Implement this with one-dimentional array, we can also have the two implementations above. (The first one is to fill in the table row by row, the second one is to fill in the table column by column)

To compare, 0-1 Knapsack Problem, we have:
entry.summary:
1. Description

Given n kinds items,each
